title: Scene 1 - fleeing the crossroads towards the Docks
where_when:
as the crossroads fade into memory you arrive at the North part of Island. 

its mid morning, Grey, windy and cold  and you have arrived at the marina
text:
You emerge from the path into the north end of town.the air feel's wrong, like the world’s holding its muggy breath. to the left you see a nearly empty marina. Only one ship remains, a ragged crew scrambling across its deck while a large scary man bellows orders.

 to the left of you homes and Shops along the waterfront are hastily boarded, doors braced with mismatched scraps, splintered fence posts, broken crates. The air feels tight with panic.

People hurry through the streets with carts, baskets, and bags heaped with food and valuables. Some push wheelbarrows piled high; others clutch bundles over their shoulders.They all seem to be heading in the same direction as they head for the small foothills in the distance, cautious eyes dart constantly toward the sea.

You stop and mutter, “What the hell is going on?”
exit_line: I Cant help the feeling like i have been in this situation at least once before...is this.... Deja-vu?

title: heading towards the last boat in the Marina
where_when: You shove through the wind and the stink of wet rope, boots splashing through puddles that taste of iron as you run for the lone ship at the pier.
text:
The closer you get, the worse it looks, men hauling ropes with wild eyes, what looks like farmers, the men and women bound to the rail with torn fabric, children sobbing their cries rising and falling with the sound of waves slapping against the hull.
 The scary captain with an Austrian accent bellows out at you... Come with me if you want to live, you grab the last morring line holding the boat to the doc and swing aboard saving the captain and crew from having to cut it
exit_line: You're skeptical, but a lack of information make's this the best  option.

title: Running for the Hills
text: You sprint with the crowd toward the low hills. The ground trembles. The sea goes silent behind you.
exit_line: You’ve got seconds. Pick wrong and the sea decides.

title: Boarding the Ship
text: You decide to climb aboard, ignoring the screams and confusion around you. The deck reeks of salt and fear. The captain shouts for lines to be cut as the ship lurches against its moorings.The captain you realize, is trying to save people despite his brutal demeanor. The storm builds.
exit_line: At a speed you would not have expected The ship begins to pull away from the dock. as if being pulled out to sea

title: Too Late
text:
Your determined to discover the Malady that could be the cause of this Panic, in the distance  The crowd runs inland. The sea goes quiet, then slowly drains, your limbs frozen at the site of it. the ocean revealing it scars and debris on its sandy underbelly 

suddenly you see it. the wall of water coming straight at you, what must have been moments feels like seconds, theres no where to go and nothing to do about it, the sky is blanketed over in salty darkness as the wave starts to crest 
.suddenly you feel your chest cave, as your lungs explode, instantly your crushed by a wall of cold wet Darkness.
exit_line: Congratz!! Your story ends in Tragic fashion.

title: Too Late in the Foothills
text:
You flee the madness at the docks and follow the crowd toward the small foothills. You have nothing to carry and easily overtake several people weighed down by their possessions. The ground trembles underfoot. The sound of the sea fades into an eerie silence.

Then the sky darkens. You turn your head and see it—the horizon rising, the ocean folding over itself. The wall of water races inland, swallowing rooftops and roads. What must have been moments feels like seconds. There is nowhere to go and nothing to do about it. The world is swallowed in salt and roar and cold. Your chest caves as your lungs collapse. You are gone before you can even scream.
exit_line: The sea takes everything, even the hills.

title: Too Late at the Docks
where_when: North docks, as the ship pulls away.
text: You step back from the rail and turn to flee, but the moorings snap like thread and the crowd surges. The sea goes silent, then rises to swallow the pier. You try to run, but salt and sky and weight crush you flat. There is no time to scream.
exit_line: Some choices only look like safety.

title: Holding Fast — The Wave Rises
text: The deck tilts skyward as the sea climbs the sky. You wrap your arms around the main mast while crewmen vanish into the foam. The captain’s voice cuts through the roar: "Jump!" For a heartbeat you hesitate, staring up at the wall of water folding over the ship. You can’t hold any longer. It’s jump or die.
exit_line: Seconds left. Pick.

title: Wave-ing goodbye
text: You cling to the mast until your arms give out. The world folds and the deck erupts. Timber, iron, salt, and dark. Your lungs never get that next breath.
exit_line: The sea does not bargain.

title: Thrown into the Deep — The Backside of the Wave
where_when: Midday becomes midnight as the wave crests overhead. The ship tilts skyward, and you leap.
text:
You jump. For a moment, it feels like flying — then everything is cold and chaos. The sound disappears, replaced by pressure and silence. You tumble through foam and wreckage, lungs on fire, the world flipping end over end.

Your shoulder hits something hard — maybe the ship’s broken mast — but it spins you just right. The back side of the wave pulls you down, then hurls you forward with terrifying speed.

When you finally break the surface, the world is gone. The ship, the dock, the city — all erased. Only floating debris and distant thunder remain.

You cling to a barrel and let the current take you. The stars vanish. The mist thickens. Somewhere ahead, faint singing cuts through the noise.
exit_line: You drift in the dark, waiting to learn whether the sea meant to kill you or spare you.

title: Lost to the Current
text: You loosen your grip and let the ocean decide. The song fades. The cold does not.
exit_line: Some endings are just the sea closing over.

title: Below Deck — The Hold
where_when: Cargo hold, lantern light, wet boards.
text: Bodies packed tight. would be survivors are tied to beams and rails. The air is sour with Urine and  fear. Water starts finding the seams. this is probably not the best place to be!
exit_line: Stuck between a morgue and a sandbar.

title: The Broken Hold — Survivors in the Wreck
where_when: Below deck, after the wave. The ship is half-buried against the rocks, creaking but still intact.
text:
You wake in darkness, the sound of dripping water close to your ear. The air tastes of rot and rust. The ship didn’t sink — it split, wedged between jagged black rocks. Half the hold is flooded. The other half is a tomb of splintered beams and crushed bodies.

Someone nearby coughs. Then another voice answers — hoarse, desperate. A handful of survivors crawl through the wreckage, gathering in the only pocket of dry space left.

You can hear the sea outside, grinding at the hull like teeth. There’s no telling how long the wreck will hold.

A narrow gap in the planks shows pale daylight above — an escape, if you dare.

choices.label: Stay below and wait for help

exit_line: The ship creaks like it’s whispering its last words.

title: The Waiting
text: You wait. The hull groans. The light narrows to a coin. The sea comes in to collect.
exit_line: Silence, then bubbles, then none.

title: The Sirens' Welcome — Salt and Sweetness
where_when: Shoreline cave, torchlight flickering on wet stone.
text:
The liquid burns like salt and honey. For a heartbeat you think you’re dying again, lungs filling with the sea. Then you cough, and breathe — the air thick, heavy, alive.

They carry you into a shallow cave carved by tides. Shells glow in the walls like trapped stars. Someone wraps your wounds with sea-silk; another hums a tune that pulls your heartbeat into rhythm.

When you wake, the three of them sit in a circle around you. Bowls of strange fruit glisten in the sand. Their eyes shine like wet coins.

'You fell from the storm,' the tallest one says. 'But storms do not choose who survives. Tell us, land-born — why did the sea spare you?'

Their smiles are gentle, but something sharp hides behind them. You can feel it — like teeth under velvet.
exit_line: Their voices blend with the tide, patient and hungry for truth.

title: The Survivor of the Deep
where_when: Still within the sirens' cave, somewhere between night and dawn.
text: "You are so Thirsty., The liquid burns, you continue drinking  out of thirst and desperation,  As soon as you drink from the conch, you wonder if you shouldn’t of been more cautious. There is an immediate  sense of relief from the pain.  at the same time, everything that happened immediately overwhelms you, you break down in tears. You tell these beautiful, strange creatures  everything — the crossroads, the ship at the marina, the people inside the boat hoping for escape; now entangled in seaweed and smashed upon the rocks, you recount the screams, the black wall of water. The words fall out of you in pieces, salt-bitten and raw. By the time you finish, the cave creatures are silent, Weariness  finally stills your once uncontrolled sobbing. The tallest siren moves closer. She touches your chest, her hand cool and slick. “No lies,” she announces softly to the coven. Narrowing her eyes at you she says, “We will save you land-born, as you are the first we have come across that has controlled their deceitful tongue and their lust
exit_line: You drift beneath the waves, weightless and awake, listening for another voice to answer the song.

title: The Eaten
where_when: Inside the sirens' cave. The tide creeping higher.
text: You force a smile and tell them what you think they want to hear — a Hero's story, of slavers, chains, sword-fights and escape. The lie comes easy. Too easy. The three seductive and unnaturally beautiful creatures nod toward each other, smiling in silent agreement. They seem to believe you as one of them gently offers a new shell, winking seductively as you lift it to your lips. It is sweeter than the first. You gulp it down greedily, relieved they’ve accepted your lie. The tallest one moves closer, her expression unreadable. Her lips brush yours, tasting your mouth with her tongue. Her breath cool and sweet, like apples and vanilla orchids, and in that instant, you fall in love. Gradually the light in the cave shifts. The lust in her eyes doesn’t fade; it sharpens, glinting with the calm focus of hunger. Shadows stretch along the walls as her voice sharpens. 'Pitiful land-born,' she says. 'We can taste truth on the air.' With one graceful motion she slaps the shell from your hands. 'The drink will teach you honesty.' Your stomach twists. It burns. Your tongue goes numb. You try to stand, but your legs will not move. Paralyzed, you watch as their lovely mouths open wide, revealing rows of slick, needle sharp teeth. They close in, humming the same alluring tune that brought you here. You scream once, salt and blood fill your throat, and then you drown again, slower this time, as they tear into your limbs and torso. The water goes dark with blood and rendered flesh, the pain makes the world fold in on itself. You feel your soul tear loose and rise, breaking the surface far above. The last thing you see is your own body sinking below, motionless. Then everything turns white, and you find yourself standing once more at the crossroads, with no memory of how you got there.
exit_line: The sea keeps its secrets. You just became one of them.
